article_text:
Business owners can avoid paying a new 3.8% investment tax on their profits by taking on an active role in running the enterprise. But they need to be able to document their workload and maintain that work level year after year, experts say.

The additional tax on net investment income, which was enacted as part of the Affordable Care Act, took effect in 2013. It is levied on dividends, capital gains and other investment income for...
